body.para: The Admin Portal has been revised with an emphasis on providing operators without full administrative privilege, the tools required to assist in solving common participant problems such as resolving online (Eway) payment issues and providing assistance for those having problems logging in.

list.li: Interface to summary is now via a tabbed UI. This provides a cleaner interface and more vertical space for data.
The Received grid now includes a toolbar with the ability to select a From and To date range.
The Add/Edit Member grid now includes a standard grid toolbar.

A new tab titled, Online Payment Status provides the ability to review the status of online payments and the ability to resubmit payments to Eway if necessary. This grid provides the same functionality as the Review Online Payment Status module.
A new tab titled, Review Logins provides similar functionality as Login & Role Assignment except for the following...
Only login records for logins without roles are displayed.
bulk operations such as Create Domain Login, Populate Logins, Set Email Confirmed and Reset Password have been removed.
Improved the welcome experience for new members. If a new member, the software will proceed directly to the Member Details form rather than displaying the menu.
A toast message is now displayed when a grid is restored from a saved state,
Revised the grid column, Other Class to display the day and start time of class if a participant is waitlisted in the selected class but enrolled in another class for the same course.
Revised the Enrollment Report to print the day and start time of class if a participant is waitlisted in the printing class but enrolled in another class for the same course.

Added new report, Unsuccessful Requests List. This is a report of members who have requested enrollment in one or more classes but are waitlisted in all. In other words, all their enrollment requests have thus far been unsuccessful.
A new column, 1 per Student is now displayed on the grid. It will be checked if a course with multiple classes is restricted to one class per student.
A new column, Other Class is now displayed on the grid if the course participation type is Different participants in each class. The column will be ticked if...
the participant is waitlisted in the current class, and
The participant is enrolled in another class in that course.
